Reviews.Title: “Old and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night ia a room near the toilets and I woke up with noise of people going to bathroom. The room was smal as a corridor and everything looked old and old fashioned. The good think is that it is very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly hotel policy”
Reviews.Author: funkit
Reviews.Content: I'm from Ã  country that has no seasonal time difference, i.e. we do not move our clock one hour forward in summer. I went to the hotel restaurant for breakfast at around 9.30am to today as breakfast closes at 10. I was told no free breakfast could be served as by summer time it was already 10.30. I asked them to do a favour as not all guests were aware of the change. They insisted that everybody knows. They charged another man for breakfast too. I asked they can do this gentleman a favour as well!! It's Just breakfast they had prepared to serve anyway!!! They said no. I think they as members of the hospitality, they should yesterday bother to remind guests the breakfast would be set earlier. This only happened twice a year and the hotel won't suffer from losses! I chose this hotel because of it's location and that it is not expensive but this service really destroyed my impression about it.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Tight â€¦”
Reviews.Author: RouteBG
Reviews.Content: While this place has a number of pluses [e.g., location and friendliness of the staff] the bed bug issue is not to be denied. I am back home from 4 nights at the Hotel Old Quarter over the weekend. I read of the little critters and was, I suppose, prepared to take my chances â€”and the first two nights, I experienced no problem. However, the red, itchy blotches began to appear soon thereafter, particularly on my right foot, which must have properties especially appealing to these creatures. My main hope is that I didn't bring any of the insects home. The Hotel Old Quarter is one of the lowest cost places I was able to find online for my stay in Amsterdam, yet it was more expensive than bedbug-free and more comfortable, equally well-located places in which I had just stayed in Nice and Paris. Yes, Paris. Until they resolve the bug issue, I can't recommend the place. I guess Amsterdam is just not for hotel bargain-hunters.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: katie c
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Amsterdam after a 2 night stay at this hotel. I booked it for my boyfriend as a surprise for his 30th birthday. Like a lot of the reviews we thought the location of this hotel was excellent but thats about it. On arrival we checked in and was told our room was not in the main hotel but in a building on the opposite side of the road, this particular building was awful, you entered through a little banged up side door, the bottom half on the building was boarded up, the stairs are dangerous- not good first impressions!! The room itself was basic and dirty, we had a double room with private bathroom, the double bed is actually two singles pushed together, the only half decent thing about the room was the space. I have to say when walking out of this building and onto the street we actually felt embarrassed that we were staying there. In the end we complained and the staff agreed to move us into a room in the main hotel building, this room was much nicer with a view of the canal but still very basic and a little dirty. I paid 180euros for our 2 night stay, I went with low expectations of this hotel and thought it would be adequate for our needs however, I was surprised that it was even worse than I was expecting. My advise to anyone thinking of booking this hotel is -Dont do it! pay the extra 100euros and get youself booked into the Ibis, however if you do decide to stay here make sure you ask for a room in the main hotel and dont expect much!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Russian Roulette!”
Reviews.Author: John9991
Reviews.Content: Myself and friends stayed here. When we woke up in the morning we were covered in bites and red blotches, on closer inspection there were black and green little round bugs on the walls, in the sink and up the bed. My friends in the other room had no problems though so when I went to complain to the manager he said it must have been because I was with a woman in the red light district! Disgusting! Especially as my fiancee was standing beside me. The reviews on this hotel show a bed bug problem going back many years, is there no environmental health inspections in Holland this excuse for a hotel has to answer to? This place needs closed down and fumigated or something done. I have read good reviews too so if you book this hotel your are taking a big chance. Good luck!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing time!!!”
Reviews.Author: rachel g
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for one night.. It is in the heart of Amsterdam, minutes from the train station, Dam square, Red Light DIstrict.. Nothing is more than ten mins walk at most. The room we stayed in had 2 single beds end to end, up 2 'typically Dutch, ankle twisting flights of stairs'. The room was no 5 star luxury suite, but if you're going to Amsterdam to enjoy time in a hotel room, you shouldn't really be going to Amsterdam. We had the breakfast that was included, which was perfect for the 'Dam hangover! The staff were lovely and very helpful... Even after we had checked out, they let us leave our luggage in their locked storage room, so we didn't have to carry it around all day, which was really nice of them! Overall I had a lovely trip, and having a hotel so close to everything that did good food and reasonably priced drinks in the bar just topped it off!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Saah1
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel! Staff were really friendly! It's right in the centre of everything! Our room was amazing! Looked right out onto the canal! The only 1 bad thing I could say is that the shower is attached to the wall so you can't move the shower head about! (personal issue I suppose) there was even a vending machine outside our room that sold cans of beer for â‚¬3! And you can smoke in your room! Also our flight back wasn't until 10pm but we had to be out of the room by 11am but they had a room were they allowed us to keep all our bags until we left!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: dukewantscashgoggles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights sharing a room with 2 mates. Not much I can say about it really except it was somewhere to sleep. At least it seemed clean although quite depressing inside.. The pub was quite good and had a lot of beers and it is just off warmoesstraat so it has a good location but thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but friendly”
Reviews.Author: GrainneWaterford
Reviews.Content: Old Quarter is a pub/hotel in the Red Light district of Amsterdam, but don't let that put you off; the staff are very friendly, and the accommodation is spotless and quiet. For its location, just five minutes walk from the Central Station, it's extremely good value, and you even get a "free" breakfast, even if it's a small one; bacon and a couple of fried eggs, toast and coffee. The rooms are small; the width of our "double" room was two single beds side by side, with six inches between them, but the room was long as well as narrow so there was plenty space for our baggage.

Reviews.Title: “good location thats it”
Reviews.Author: pendyWirral
Reviews.Content: we arrived for a three night stay in amsterdam as we arrived very late in the eve. we had booked a 3 star hotel ( the hotel old quater) we were moving on to another hotel the following day! thankfully! the location was great right in the center of everything, the staff were quite friendly. the room was very very basic, a twin room even though we had booked a double a door and a curtain seperated the room from a toilet and a shower (in the same space) you could hear every moment from the other rooms. breakfast was included in the price when we went for breakfast (10 mins before the end) we were told the cooker had broken and there was only cheese and bread available even though everyone around us had eggs bacon etc. the point im making is that no way is this hotel a 3 star standard. (not exactly cheap either we paid 100 euros for the room for on night)

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we hoped it would be!!”
Reviews.Author: jambags
Reviews.Content: WOW! what a great weekend we had, helped by some nice people in the hotel!! We arrived on Friday morning 9am for my friends stag do, me as best man had booked room for 21 of us, to be paid on arrival! check in is meant to be 2pm, however, the hotel allowed any of us whos room was available earlier to move into them there and then, which isnt something they have to do, so nice touch! the hotel is basically a pub with restaurant, and rooms above, but in an ideal location on the outskirts of the red light district, 2 minutes from the train station! Cant speak highly enough of the staff, 20 rowdy men staying and drinking, andn ot one member of staff had aporoblem or wasnt friendly, all happy to help, the food there is nice enough! Rooms were basic, beds, tv, table n chair and one wardrobe, with a walk in shower and toilet, but it was all nice and clean, and the canal view rooms have a lovely view, specially room 40!!! Check out was easy going to, left on the monday morning, but 11am isnt a stringent demand, and they have an area to leave your luggage too till you leave for home!! All in all, for us, it was a fantastic base in which to explore both the finer parts and seedy spots of amsterdam!! and for the price, absolutely couldnt ask for more!!! We will be back next year, im sure of it!!

Reviews.Title: “JOHN”
Reviews.Author: daytrippereire
Reviews.Content: Just back great location basic room but very clean, the food was very good the staff in this hotel are the nicest iv ever met, the chef Mike, what a talent not alone is he a great cook but can he play that guitar, something else!! marlina robert and amy thank ye all xxx

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but central & good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Stuart L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times now. The rooms are very basic with shared facilities, but the location is very good. You'll find the rooms noisy if you have one on the Warmoestraat side so try to avoid those. The beds are very poor camp style things and not very comfy. On the plus side the breakfast is included in the price and is very good. About as cheap as hotels get in central Amsterdam. Ideal for budget travellers, just don't expect any luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Tori_Chester
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the bank holiday weekend with a friend! We had a twin room with shared bathroom facilities. Paid â‚¬340 for 4 nights. The location of this hotel is brilliant. Literally 2 minute walk to Dam Sq and the Red Light District. Even though the hotel is right in the centre of everything you get a good nights sleep. The rooms are very basic but adequate. Having shared facilities wasn't a problem for us, but this would really depend on the other hotel guests - so luck of the draw really! Also breakfast was included - bacon and eggs standard! Which was nice also! The staff here are really great, helpful and friendly! I would definitely stay here again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bestbenidorm
Reviews.Content: just returned from amsterdam,this was our 2nd visit to the hotel,and we based it on location, straight out the train station 5min walk and its there, the staff are so friendly cant do enough for you,be aware alcohol in amsterdam is the most expensive we have paid for, up to 8 euro for a pint of lager, but in the hotel it was 5.50 euro a pint, food is very very good, rooms are very basic but clean, when booking we would suggest requesting a room at the back of the hotel,as there are 4 floors to the hotel and its only the back ones that have a lift to them,the front ones are up a very very steep staircase(typical amsterdam staircase) the pub has a really warm atmosphere check in straight forward,we love the hotel must add its in the red light district not suitable to everyone but full of character, and yes we will be going back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location - clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: superiorcold
Reviews.Content: There are mixed reviews for this place, but we had a fine stay. The room was VERY small but adequat for the little amount of time we spent there. It is located in the Red light district, which made for some interesting walking, but we always felt safe walking around. It is in good location to the train station and about 6 blocks from Dam sqaure. VERY easy walk. Bathroom was shared on the 3rd floor but both the shower and the toilet were clean. There was adequat paper, soap and paper towels too. We had a sink and table in our room too. The hotel is located above a pub/resturaunt but check in was easy and the staff was nice. Internet is free, but you have to sit in the resturaunt to get the signal. We left too early the next morning to eat breakfast- so can't tell you on that. Overall, great location and clean rooms. Wouldn't heistate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the rest, give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Jamesmatthewtaylor
Reviews.Content: 20 of us stayed here for 3 days and for what we paid it was superb. Clean rooms, good food and friendly staff couldn't ask for more really. I can't imagine what the moaners expected for the money they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings . . .”
Reviews.Author: NGB_May2007
Reviews.Content: Hotel Old Quarter is a hotel, if you can call it that, with a very small "h". It's a bar that lets out the rooms on the floors above or, in our case, provided a room above a closed down bar directly opposite - the formerly named Hotel Harbour (graded as one star, although the rooms above number 22 are graded as two). Located at the North end of Warmoestraat, about five minutes walk from Amsterdam Central Railway station. It's smack in the Bohemian quarter of old Amsterdam and amongst a vast array of dope cafes, bars, sex shops, eateries and other retail outlets - an epicentre for young, hedonistic visitors to the city. Our room? Basic but generally clean. The ensuite was fully functional with plenty of hot water and had been cleaned prior to our arrival - the exception was the floor which was minging and hadn't seen a scrubbing brush in many months. What was a pleasant surpise was that we could receive BBC worldwide on the 14" CRT TV in our room. We didn't suffer any of the bed-bug problems that many other contributors report. The included breakfast? The Old Quarter offers a full English at EURO 7.00, and this is offered to guests at a EURO 5.00 per person supplement. If, as we did, you decide to stick with the "basic" it's two eggs, bacon, toast and coffee/tea. It filled the early morning gap, but a little more TLC in the kitchen wouldn't go astray (and that's not just our's but other full English's we saw being served a well). In a similar vein, there was also the attitude of one particular young lady who covered the morning shift behind the bar there - watching how she dealt with a minor complaint from a guest when we were having breakfast was priceless entertainment to start the day with. So, EURO 80.00 a night for a twin - value for money? The Netherlands is an expensive place to visit, and Amsterdam probably tops the league table of Dutch cities (my wife and I visited four during our time there). You won't find too much at lower cost in the city centre, and if you want to stay in amongst all of the action, I suspect this place is probably as good as anywhere else - if you don't expect too much beyond a clean bed for the night and hot and cold running water you won't be disappointed. If you want to stay in a hotel then you need to look elsewhere, but you will pay for it - at the time of writing, the three star hotel two minutes walk away in Warmoestraat was charging EURO 229.00 per night for a twin. Puts things in perspective, doesn't it?

Reviews.Title: “BED BUG'S - NEVER STAY HERE - SERIOUSLY, DON'T STAY HERE !!!!”
Reviews.Author: pacman2510
Reviews.Content: Having recently returned back from this hotel, I have now come up with lots of itchy spots all over my body. This is due to the dirty rooms, filthy sheets making it a haven for bed bugs. The hotel room looked dirty as soon as we walked in, we was only staying for a night so this was no issue at the time. You don't notice the bed buds till late at night when your ready to go to bed. Comments on here from over 2 years ago stated the same, and for the hotel to show this much neglect by not doing anything about it, really is quite disgusting. The more people that read these comments should take real note from these comments. It's not what you expect when you stay somewhere. I have stayed in a lot worse rooms down the koh San Road and felt a lot cleaner and safer there. WE WILL NEVER STAY AT THIS DIRTY LITTLE HOLE AGAIN. Wish I had read the reviews first. I am going to email the manager to ask for a refund. Mainly due to the fact that this has been going on at the hotel for years and continues to do so. It is very uncomfortable having these BED BUG BITES all over my body and if you stay at this hotel, then you will all see what everyone means. The best thing to do is to avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, friendly staff, amazing food and live music.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisRockSteady
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at hotel old quater we were greeted by a very friendly lady at the bar who checked us in, gave us our keys and a card intitling us to a discount when we ate at the hotel, the room we were givin did not have a double bed only two singles, not a problem for us though, we just pushed them together, the room over looked the canal and each morning we were awoke by a few of the local ducks lol. breakfast was provided free of charge and wasnt anything special but did the job, bacon eggs and toast with a cup of dutch coffee, no complaints there and the staff were willing to acomadate my partner who does not like eggs and allowed her to have something differnt free of charge. we also had dinner in the hotel twice and the food was amazing, I would recomend the dutch stake! the bar downstairs have live music on a thursday and had a local rock/punk band in playing which was right up my street as i'm into punk music. if this is not your thing then not to worry as you cannot hear the music from the hotel rooms. Drinks in the bar were fairly expensive but this is the case throughout most of amsterdam. the hotel is located quite close to the red light district, many bars, 'coffee shops', and adult shops so if you are planning a family break i would not recomend this hotel as it is in the center of the cities night life. because of this the hotel understandable has alot of guests who are in the city for just that reason to have fun, so if you are looking for a quiet break then again I would not recomend as you may have alot of 18 - 30s getting a bit rowdy and staying up very late and noise tends to carry in this hotel. Ive seen alot of reviews saying there was no lift and the stairs were steep, we'll all stairs in amsterdam are steep so thats something you'll need to get used to and WE had a lift right up to our floor, however one side of the hotel does not have a lift and is only accessable by stairs. all in all i enjoyed my stay at hotel old quater! prices were great!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been”
Reviews.Author: GBarta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Old quarter Hotel last weekend. Most comments about it looked OK at the time we booked and the price (100euros/night) was fine - we booked a dobule room with private bathroom. However our stay was terrible. The hotel is in the nosiest and dirtiest par of the city, the rooms are old and quite dirty, IKEA-furnished, no lift and amazingly steep stairs, plus the staff is unfriendly. It's fine if you are looking for an hostel, but forget about the benefits of an hotel. I would never go back!

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: qwerty239125
Reviews.Content: tiny room on top of five flights of stairs shared toilet and shower dirty. bed bugs no window i was in attic brecky was poor two greasy bacon two greasy eggs toast and jam ok bang in center so that was ok staff were fine with me overall cant remember much so must of had great time long as i was not in hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not Fancy but Location Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Michelle80Australia
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room and ended up with 2 singles at different heights pushed together but after 30 hrs of flying I didnt bother to complain. The internet didnt work in our rooms we had to stand in the hallway to get access. We checked out too early for breakie but all in all friendly enough and safe place to stay. Its in a pub so food was easy to come by and sevice was friendly. Would stay again for convenience, but rooms could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly-excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EuroSpy
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about staying at the Old Quarter Hotel after reading some of the reviews here and I couldn't stop nagging at my boyfriend to try and find another place for us to stay but THANK GOD it seems all my fears were exaggerated-I don't know if we just got lucky but we were given the attic room overlooking the docks and apart form the nice view the room was EXCELLENT in terms of cleanliness,which was all I cared about really.I had carried my own bedsheets and towels but didn't have to use them.Definitely no bedbugs around.Otherwise the room was very basic but I didn't really expect any luxuries,I just wanted a nice clean place to stay.I didn't even carry my netbook along,so no idea about the wireless but I didn't need it at all.Staff was amazing-very friendly and helpful.Location couldn't be better,close to everything.I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very very basic”
Reviews.Author: nick_higgins
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as it was a central hotel and cheap. The room was very cheap and rthe location was very central + the bar it is attached too is very nice, niceer than the hotel rooms. Stayed with my wife and would only stay again for sentimental reasons as the room was very very basic. I was bitten by something in the room any arm swlled up. Our room did have two doors that opened up onto the Canal behind the Damrak and I was able to feed the ducks whilst sitting on my bed.

Reviews.Title: “seeing is believing”
Reviews.Author: winstonblack
Reviews.Content: after reading some very mixed reviews we went ahead and booked this hotel what a pleasent surprise lovely canal veiw from our room the ensuite bathroom was big for amsterdam most being telephone box size the staff were very friendly and the breakfast while basic was very tasty as some reviews say theres a problem with bed bugs our room was bed bug free and very clean and tidy the only downside was our room was right next to the security door which buzzes every time its opened to let guests in plus side at least we knew it was only hotel guests outside your room door will definatley stay again

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: shajkhulla
Reviews.Content: there are bedbugs we saw in the room . Moreover they bited us and my wife has alergie. The worst thing we found out several in our appartment moved with our laggage I suppose and we have to call for special desinfection service that may cost more than we pay for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with character in the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: philie2305
Reviews.Content: The Old Quarter Hotel is located in the centre of town literally 2 minutes from Centraal station which was really handy as we did not arrive until late. The lady that was checking us in was really unfriendly but besides this initial impression we found the staff really helpful and friendly. You could borrow an iron from reception at no extra cost. The room I was staying in was at the top of the house (Harbour Hotel) and had a brilliant view. The room itself was basic but clean with character. With this room the shower was shared. They are really powerful and hot which was nice after a day of sightseeing. Everything is on your doorstep and the tram line is nearby although we didnâ€™t need to use one as it was so central. I would have no hesitation staying here again as it was really reasonable price wise.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet despite central location but poor quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: MagicTasha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very central and near by to the tourist attractions, and despite this it was very quiet at night. The room was very small, containing two single beds in a line (not next to each other). The room had a TV which didn't work (a wire was hanging out of it). The shared bathroom was clean. The stairs that go up to the rooms are very steep and there was what looked like dried blood on the wall by these stairs. In order to get up to the rooms the staff have to press a button to open the door, and the staff do not let guests bring other people into the rooms. The included breakfast was tea or coffee and eggs, bacon and toast, you could also upgrade to a full English breakfast for an extra payment.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hospitality and location”
Reviews.Author: theparkypoo22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was based in a really lively and quirky area, besides the red light district. The hotel had a pub downstairs which was very homely, yet lively and had a live band on when we were there. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, especially when we had to arrive late due to delayed flights. The breakfast was basic, but free and all you needed really. There was clean linen. And the reception was open 24 hours. The only thing really was that the bedrooms were quite basic and narrow, the two twin beds were in a single line. The walls were quite thin, so we could sometimes hear next door. We had a shared bathroom, which was fine and was right outside our door, but it did run out of hot water sometimes. But we enjoyed staying here, because we were only in our room to sleep and get ready to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs! Never stay there!”
Reviews.Author: Innelein
Reviews.Content: It's a completely disgusting hotel. You should NEVER stay there! First, instead of the fact that we booked a twin room they gave us a single room +1 additional bed. (this room was aprox 2m wide and 7m length). Actually there weren't beds at all. There were cots. Then another surprise - bedbugs! We asked for another room but the hotel staff said "no rooms, sorry". When we mentioned bedbugs they said only "oh" and then forgot about us at all. We are still in big red spots after these bugs and still itching. Also we saw a black mold at the ceiling of wc! And how a cat caught a mouse in the pub situated at the first floor of the hotel. It was a completely nightmare :(

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you get a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Ultra-One
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through hoteliers.com for 3 nights (Thur to Sat) but when i went there i realized that they were never informed of my booking. The strange thing about this hotel is that the entrance is a restaurant/pub with the hotel reception in the same place, and a secure door that it is opened by the staff to lead to the rooms. The VERY friendly and helpful staff arranged for me to stay there for Thursday night, but they told me that unfortunately they were fully booked for Friday and Saturday so i had to check out in the morning (it wasn't their fault for this mess anyway so i don't blame them, but i do blame hoteliers.com). The small room i was given did not have view as it was internal but was clean, warm, had it's own shower/toilet and was tidy and quiet. There was free Wi-Fi in the Restaurant area, and a relatively ok breakfast was served for free in the morning (coffee or tea, bacon, 2 eggs, 3 pieces of toast and 3 different jams). The helpful staff kept my luggage for half a day in a safe storage room until i found another hotel. All in all, it is not a bad hotel as they offer rooms facing Warmoerstraat (if you don't mind the noise), and also rooms facing the canal on the other side. I would definitely go there again as the staff is extremely friendly and helpful, and it is in a very good location, but i would contact the hotel directly to do the booking, and ask a room with a view! :)

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay again!”
Reviews.Author: lolli-83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a great stay here. The room was basic but clean and had a lovely view over the canal. It is so close to the station and really easy to find. Minutes walk to all the places you want to go. The staff were really nice, always helpful and friendly. You have to leave your key which was great because you dont have to worry about losing it. 10% discount was nice in the restaurant and the food was simple and pretty good. We'd stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: eeesh
Reviews.Content: this is the first time I have stayed in a quad room,the room is quite basic but the bonus is you have an en suite shower/toilet. Our towels were changed every day and the floor hoovered.Breakfast is sparse but it is free after all so that is to be expected. Great central location and we found the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Sever bed bug problem”
Reviews.Author: ads_213
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while back packing Europe for the one night. It was a good location for what we wanted being near the station and red light district. It was nothing like the description we were given, we are a young couple but the room was more like a small corridor with 2 single beds against the length of the wall. I was a bit disappointed but as my girlfriend pointed out, it is Amsterdam and cheap so we were satisfied. However, during the night she got up to use the toilet and noticed some small shadows on the wall near the lamp. we turned the light on to see the wall covered with a mixture of bugs (non flying which wouldn't be the hotels fault). some were tiny bed bugs while some were huge. We flicked as many off the bed as we could and tried to sleep until i needed the toilet. we again found several on the bed, one which exploded with blood when i flicked it indicating it had just bitten one of us and one in my eye brow. we decided we couldn't stay any longer and left at 5 in the morning. We couldn't see them in the day but the room had a very thick dirty carpet so im guessing they live in/under it. its the worst hotel experience ive ever had, regret not complaining at the time but we just wanted to get out. From the lack of other complains i can only assume people are too drunk/stoned to notice and that some of the rooms must be a lot nicer than the one we got. You can see from my other reviews that im not a picky traveller, I really recommend avoiding this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming!”
Reviews.Author: PearlMBlr
Reviews.Content: The placeis right in the middle of Amsterdam within a 5min radius of all the place you must see...the breakfast is pretty good and homely...a warm staff ..The bar is amzing and the hotel does give you an old feeling of warmth The rooms are a little small...but then it's not a place where you would want to be indoors:)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent loaction”
Reviews.Author: Ruth102
Reviews.Content: For all the lenght of time that your in the room when visiting amsterdam we dont really look for anything other than its location and clean, best location we coulda got - only 5 mins walk from centraal station, close to everything, the rooms were basic but clean and staff were really friendly - unless you want luxury then this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Old Quarter”
Reviews.Author: matt_d_rat
Reviews.Content: Set in the heart of Amsterdam the Old Quarter hotel is only a stones throw away from all the attractions this beautiful city has to offer. For three nights staying at hotel Old Quarter set us back â‚¬120 each, which isn't too bad considering its location. This price also includes a free breakfast, consisting of a fried egg, bacon and toast. The hotel itself is quite clean and very well kept. We slept two people to a room. The rooms themselves were a little small, but since we were out and about for the majority of the day this didn't really bother us. On some evenings the Old Quarter has live musicians playing in the bar, who were very good and very entertaining. All round a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, worth paying extra to overlook the Canal.”
Reviews.Author: donnyholidaymaker
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very happy with this hotel. Although it was rather pricey for a double en-suite (90 Euros), two years ago we paid about 60 Euros to stay in a cupboard with no windows! That's why we chose to splash out a bit, and so happy we did. After reading other reviews that say how noisy the street is, if you pay for a room over looking the Canal, you are away from all of this. We were in room 22 and had a comfortable, quiet nights sleep. The wet room/toilet was clean, and the room itself was big and airy. We were shocked to see two huge windows that opened fully to give a great view of the city. The location was fantastic, just next to the red light district and you could even see the Grand Central Station from our room. The staff were friendly, and always prompt to get our keys and buzz us through to our room. The breakfast that was included was nice, although choice was non-existant. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless Nights!!”
Reviews.Author: JackieVirtue
Reviews.Content: I hated this hotel! Pretty much from the moment we walked in! The girl behind the bar was grumpy and spoke like she couldnt really be bothered with us. We had to leave the key behind the bar every time we left, then stand like idiots while hotel staff took ages to press the special buzzer to open the stupid door! We stayed in room 11 which was at the front on the first floor looking right onto the street. I slept for about 2 hours maximum a night in the place. There is a coffeeshop next door and one across the steet, infact all the way down the street. Everynight up until 4 or 5 in the morning people were outside shouting and singing, if you were lucky you got between around 6 and 7am is was quiet but then the bin men come around 7 and words cannot describe how loud it was. Everytime anyone moved around upstairs it was like a herd of Elephants. On the last night we had to get up to get out by 11am and I'd had to little sleep that when the bin mean came I had to put my headphones in my ears or I was going to scream! Seem to be covered in bites, and noticed a few other people saying that so it obviously hasnt been sorted, sooo itchy and all over my body. We did eat there one night and even with 10% it was still rather pricey. Shared bathroom was ok. Shower was disgusting, very small and no where to even hang your towel! Towel had to go on the floor and ended up getting soaked along with the rest of my clothes I had to take in with me to avoid walking back to my room in just a towel. The rest of the staff were extremely helpful apart from the one girl with the nose peircing. On the last day when we were checking out she said ' are you checking out?' and we said yes, she then just said 'ok then' and we were waiting to ask if we could leave our bags somewhere she turned her back then turned round giving us a flithy look as if to say 'why are you still here!?' Room was ok, no remote for the tv! (no one like getting out of bed to switch of the tv!) very very basic, no worth the money at all!! Definatley wouldnt recommed this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: Briony1490
Reviews.Content: I stayed in amsterdam for 3 days, 2 nights. Me and my 3 friends arrived at central station and found it was only 5 minutes walk to the hotel, the hotel is in a great location (couldnt have asked for better really), its 5 minutes to dam square, 5 minutes to centre of light district. We arived at the hotel and talked to an english women who worked at the hotel/ bar. She was not very friendly and also a bit moody. However all the guests staying at the hotel were allowed to leave all their luggage at the hotel in a small storage cupboard until the room was ready. We went out for the day and them came back to go up to our room, the room was on the top floor, the was 4 single beds and a private bathroom. There was also a tv which had alot of english channels on it. Breakfast was included in the price, you got 2 eggs and some bacon, alot of toast and tea or coffee. Overall it was very good value for money, we only paid Â£22 a night for bed and breakfast which is cheaper than alot of hostels in the area. Even though it was not the nicest of rooms, you are hardly paying alot of money for it and you will not be spending all you day inside the hotel. So don't listen to the reviews that say its dirty and small because yoy get what you pay for, if they wanted facilities of a 5 star hotel then they should pay out the money for it. I would definalty recommend this hotel to others. It is in the perfect location and very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdamdreamin
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel makes it! Right in the centre of everything and with the train station less than 5 minutes away. The room was basic but pleasant enough. Laura on reception was very friendly and was able to advise on lots of local attractions, and bars/coffeeshops!! All the staff were very helpful, nothing was too much trouble. A already can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for low budget”
Reviews.Author: SouthendPoppit
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful from the moment we arrived by giving us a better room with a view. Perfect location, just a few minutes walk from everything. Resteraunt is very relaxed and good food. They give you 10% off food if your staying at the hotel. Only down point that could effect some people but we didnt really find it a problem was the thin walls so you can hear if someone is going into their room next door. Apart from that would definatly reccomend if your on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel in very good location with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: brayshs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basic and clean and I can say I enjoyed the stay; I paid around Â£140 for 2 nights in one of the luxury rooms. The in the view was fantastic in this room and the hotel was located in the heart of Amsterdam with a short walk to the train station. Some of the other people I went with stayed in the smaller rooms which are fine but I would recommend paying that little bit extra for the luxury room. The staff are very nice and the food in the hotel bar is good, also next door is a super coffee shop (Hunters) but keep an eye out for one of the smoke dealers, he feels that is ok to take advantage with the smokers b by using tricks like overcharging on deals ect

Reviews.Title: “casual level of comfort with a perfect location just in an old city centre”
Reviews.Author: marroon
Reviews.Content: Very basic and clean enough hotel, with a lovely Amsterdam atmosphere - very high and narrow stairs, old windows. First room we've been offered was a really small corridor type, with 2 separate beds, after our complain we got a much better room in an opposite building - with a big double bed, 4 windows (!) on a 3rd floor! The room was just great! The location is great - you can reach most of the sights by foot, but it is too noisy for sleeping - in the night you hear the tourists all around and in the early morning they start cleaning the streets and collecting garbage from the streets - so close the windows and take the ear plugs if you have problems sleeping in a noisy places. Toilette and shower are clean enough for a shared facility, nothing scary, but I always prefer to use my own slippers. Decorations and interiors are quite old and used enough, but everything is cozy and clean, stuff is really friendly and helpful. Breakfast is small (2 fried eggs, small piece of bacon, bread with butter and jam), coffee they always give more on a request. At the hotel restaurant you have 10% discount, if you want to eat something. I would definitely come back and can recommend it for young couple or friends for a short period of time (we were 4 nights there).

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and cheap - superb location”
Reviews.Author: DCO44
Reviews.Content: Simple old Amsterdam building. The best/most expensive rooms overlook a canal. Mine was simple and comfortable with toilet and shower shared with next room. Stairs are very steep. Staff were friendly and helpful. Wonderful location - 5 minutes walk from Central Station to the North and 3 minutes to Dam Square to the South. On the west edge of the Red Light District. Loads of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Old Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Laura-Louise1986
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a three night stay at the Hotel Old Quarter, where I visited with my mum. (17th - 20th Feb 2010). We paid 205 euro's for 2 of us, for 3 nights with en suite (we booked with easytobook.com). The bar/restaurant in this hotel was very charming, played great music and served great food. However, the rooms were not of the same standard (though we didn't really expect much anyway). The rooms were very simple but contained everything you would need. Our only disappointment was the rank smell in the bathroom, which was repulsive. We reported this to reception and they bleached the bathroom but the smell re-appeared the next day. The smell was so bad that we took to using the shared facilities which were located on the downstairs landing. The breakfast in the hotel was delicious. Bacon and eggs and toast with jams. Also tea and coffee (orange juice at an additional charge). On the morning of our departure we had an early flight but the staff were more than happy to make us toast and tea at 7am. The staff in this hotel (and in Amsterdam in general) were all so helpful and pleasant. This hotel is located very close to the red light district (although not too close). It was literally a 5 minute walk from central station. The location could have been any better, we were surrounded by charming pubs and cafes selling home made pastries, buns and sandwiches. It took us 5 minutes to walk to Damn Square and about 3 mins to the Damrack where there are lots more cafes and shops (including C&A)! This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we found everything very easily. On our second day we bought tickets for the hop on/hop off water boat. This stops at various locations around Amsterdam at a cost of 20E each (located near central station). We visited the local flee market which was a great experience (pashmina's and hand made bracelets, etc, at great prices). We also visited the Anne Frank House (we booked tickets online in advance as queues were huge - 9E each!) All in all, we loved our trip and will definatley be going back. Our only disappointment was the smelly bathroom but the location was second to none!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great price.”
Reviews.Author: vinnyDevon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the old quater hotel for three nights, my friend and i had a sigle room with 2 single beds, had clean towels every morning, iam old enough to make my own bed so there was no need for being waited on hand and foot, room was clean with an excellant view of the canal, bathroom and toilet was spotless. Staff were friendly and polite, food was excellant and from the first nights meal i decided to eat all my meals at the hotel, beer was dear but very enjoyable(way to much grolsh on one evening), was privalaged to see and hear the jazz night on monday night (very good). Would i stay again? YES, a two star hotel with a 5 star attitude well done to all involved with The Old Quater Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing to say the least, and now in dispute over pre payment”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer110
Reviews.Content: All looked good, on the internet, cosy old Inn, warm welcoming attitude displayed via email, BUT. On arrival the first action was to charge the card for the full stay without showing the rooms, and on inspection the rroms are dire. Cold, uninviting, peculiar aromas wafting through the venue and the state of decor and bathroom cleanliness is highly questionable. After 30 minutes we decided to leave, just being in the room made you feel dirty. Asked for a refund, but refused - quite willing to pay for the first night, but just didn't feel safe. Local tourist info centre wasn't surprised at our findings and booked us into a 5* just around the corner for an extra 24Euro per night. Now in dispute for the 2nd night charge and have instructed AMEX to contest the payment.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, food & entertainment.”
Reviews.Author: KyleGawley
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Amsterdam over the Halloween period with a small group of friends - all of us stayed in the Old Quarter Hotel. The first thing to strike me was how close it was to Central Train Station, it was literally a few minutes walk away - the location of the hotel couldn't be better, it is very central to everything - only a stone throw away from the Red Light, and there are a massive selection of bars, coffee shops and places to eat from the minute you step out the front door. The staff where incredibly friendly and always chatting away to us, they were so laid back and helpful. The hotel was very clean and the toilets and showers where cleaned regularly. The food was fantastic, there was a great choice of British food available and I was delighted to find cheese & ham omlettes and club sandwiches on the menu - we tried several different meals during the course of our stay and all of them where top class, and very reasonably priced. There was entertainment on the Saturday night in the hotel bar in the form of a rock band, which we were told play their regularly - the atmosphere was great and the entertainment lasted long into the night. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone - we had no problems during our stay and it is in the perfect location for those wishing to explore the city, not to mention the extremely low prices.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel good staff”
Reviews.Author: luvlylynzi
Reviews.Content: the roooms in this hotel were suitable for our purpose ( somwere to sleep & get ready ) if you want better pay for better !!! the staff at the hotel are really friendly, helpfull and speak all languages. we ate at the hotel most of the stay as we found other places pricey and not as nice ( you get 10% off the menu price) , must warn i took a case that was 21 kilo's which was hilarious getting up & down the stairs of this hotel as like most in amsterdam they are steep and winding .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, in one of the best locations in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: QueenvicLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam many times, but it was the first time for my partner, so I wanted to book a hotel that was right in the middle of things, and this is it! The location is perfect, just a five minute walk from Centraal Station, and our room had a view of the Damrak. The hotel is basic but very clean, and the staff really helpful and friendly. Breakfast is adequate. I would recommend that couples book the luxury double room as you get an ensuite bathroom. The bar/restaurant is nice, the food cooked well and reasonably priced. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be EATEN alive!”
Reviews.Author: John9991
Reviews.Content: I have worked in Amsterdam for many years and always stayed at this hotel until they developed a bug problem last year. It never was the greatest hotel in the world but I am not fussy, the location was good and it was relatively cheap. Im not sure whats happened but I believe the bugs are coming up the sink and bathroom pipes and infested the rooms. I got eaten alive one night there and gave them another chance. When I went back a month later the same thing happened again. This time I got up, had a shower and left. I was able to see little black bugs and tiny green flie type insects. I knew that in the gap between me first getting eaten and the second time (which was a different room) there had to be HUNDREDS of people who suffered the same horrible experience. I to had to see the Doc and get anti biotics to rid the horrendous itching and lumps that were all over my body and face, not so good when you have to present yourself at work. Anyway, my advice is look elsewhere unless you want to stay awake all night sleeping in your clothes or walking out all scratchy to find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but great location!”
Reviews.Author: verorod
Reviews.Content: The room was small, but it looks like everything in Amsterdam is small and narrow. Best tip I can offer is to pack light and take the smallest luggage possible. Our room was originally on very top floor but there was no way our luggage would fit up the stairs. Fortunately, we were able to change rooms to the side of hotel where there is a lift to the floor we were on. Breakfast was decent and room did the trick...gave us a place to sleep and shower. Within walking distance to train station and everything else, great deal of my group!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Orla_9
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap hotel in the heart of amsterdam, that's what we got. Good value for the price. Room had two twin beds which were pushed together for us, it had a tv in the room, sink and mirror, also a small table with two chairs, shower and toilet were right outside the door. Rooms were an adequate size. We felt very secure in the room, as the door leading into the rooms was only buzzed open by staff in the bar for residents. Everything you need is on the street that Hotel Old Quarter is on, loads of lovely eating places, coffee shops and convenience shops. Also we did not experience any bed bugs. Staff were very helpful also in providing clean towels etc. On our way out we asked for beds and towels to be changed and when we got back in the evening it was done. Also no one bothered you in your room unless you asked for something. We had a lovely stay at Hotel Old Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location at good price”
Reviews.Author: ms_chief1980
Reviews.Content: When checking out this hotel online, there was quite a few negitive comments but some good reviews too. I remembered where this hotel was from our last visit. Its not a posh hotel, from the outside its a bar with reception there and at the back is a secure door that leads to all the rooms. We booked a twin room for 2 nights at 150 euros altogether from a website, we were given room 21 which was on the bottom floor, it was a basic room with twin beds (they put them together as a double for us), bathroom and tv and was clean. The view from the room was lovely, right on the water and looking over to the main street. The rooms are not huge but thats expected as its original buildings been turned into hotel rooms. Also when we go to amsterdam we are out all day long and its just somewhere to sleep. The hotel is central and around the corner is the red light district and coffee shops everywhere. I would recommend this hotel to everyone as its a perfect central location to stay. p.s - there was no bed bugs

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Red Light District.....NOT a hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyRabbit
Reviews.Content: First of all don't be fooled by the word "hotel" in the name. This is most definitely NOT a hotel, more like a back packers place than anything else. The room we got was long and skinny and just enough room for walking and to fit two single beds head to head not side by side. If you have suitcases forget it. Bathroom is just outside the room but you get a sink in the room, the walls were marked and dirty, I wouldn't walk bare foot in the carpet and bed bugs did cross my mind but lucky for me and my husband we didn't get any bites but I did read an earlier review and someone did get bitten. It's right near the red light district and you can smell the pot as soon as you walk down the street. So good for some young party animals looking for relatively cheap accommodation. Avoid if you you not. If you insist on staying good luck to you.

Reviews.Title: “Bitten By Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamJimbo
Reviews.Content: A week after staying at the Old Quarter I am still trying to get rid of more than twenty bites. After consulting my doctor he told me that I had been bitten by bed bugs and has presribed a course of antibiotics. Needless to say I am less than happy with my experience of staying here. In addition to bed bugs the rooms are very basic with stains on the wall and are very small. The location is good and the staff are friendly but the noise from the bar does permeate through to the rooms making sleep difficult. Its not a nice place to sleep in and I would never ever go back to stay but may pop into the bar again.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: anonyomous
Reviews.Content: 2 words: bed bugs!!! got up after the first night to see little dots on the wall, when i squished one, blood came out! we moved out that night and even though the owner refunded our unused stay, he denied there being a problem "there were no eggs" as if getting bitten was OK. Even after the manager who went upstairs with me to look said "i thought we got rid of them" and pulled back the mattress to reveal a rather large one where my head was. Even though i checked the room when we moved in, i guess they only come out when theres food! (you)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a short break”
Reviews.Author: AndyBeth
Reviews.Content: we booked through easytobook.com as it was much cheaper than booking direct.the hotel is good value for money and has a lift which compared to the very steep narrow stairs that a lot of dam hotels have,was great. we had a double room looking over damrak,it had tv and own bathroom and was sufficient for our needs.hotel bar shuts at 1 but opposite bar shuts at 3. i emailed the hotel direct to check my booking and they replied confirming my room. i have stayed in many hotels in dam and i would not hesitste in going back to this one. have fun its easy when there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Old Quarter... more like Hostel Old Quarter”
Reviews.Author: heyjup8ter
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Old Quarter during our backpacking trip last March. First of all, the hotel misplaced our reservation (we had a print out confirmation) and ended up making a call and putting us up in the "Hotel Shagen" down the street which they claimed was part of their hotel. It was one room with about 8-10 twin size cots. It looked like somewhere you'd stay in sleep over camp minus the sounds of crackling fires and crickets... instead we were serenaded by the sounds of loud drunks and a noisy bar across the street. The shower in the room overflowed and flooded entire bathroom every time. We were told by the staff that this happens everywhere in Amsterdam which was not the case as we asked several locals for confirmation. The bathroom also had a window that was directly across from a large balcony (I think it may have been part of a restaurant or bar) that looked directly into our bathroom. No big deal... except our bathroom did not have any shades or curtains. We ended up rigging up makeshift curtains using towels. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. It was located basically in the red light district and was close to everything. Granted it was probably not the safest location but we were traveling in a group of 4 and felt relatively safe. Oh and the free breakfast consisted of an egg/toast/tea/coffee every morning. We got sick of it around day 2 (didn't help that the waitress one day looked and sounded like she was dying of the plague) but still ate it because hey... you can't beat free when you're backpacking. It was not the worst place we stayed at during out trip but had the least value based on the cost. I should also say for the record that my friends and I are not picky... and we still would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest rooms, but good location”
Reviews.Author: hambrrrglar
Reviews.Content: The good: Less than 5 minute walk from the train station and Damrack. Very convenient to many attractions. The bad: The smallest rooms I have ever stayed in. The room was not even wide enough for two twin beds side by side. They were placed the long way. Windows have gaps in them. Since the rooms were on top of the bar and across from other bars, it was extremely noisy and no way to muffle the sound. Receptionist was also the bartender so service wasn't always the best

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location at a perfect price.”
Reviews.Author: BoozyinBolivia
Reviews.Content: We booked the Old Quarter as we were on a lad's weekend & wanted to be close to Central Station, Dam Square & of course the red light district too. It really is the perfect location from Central Station, approx 5 mins away & very easy to find. Check in was very quick & we were all in our rooms within 10 mins of arrival ( there were 14 of us, so very efficient indeed. We paid a little extra & got a cracking view of canal at the rear, looking across to Central Station & a slightly bigger room too. The room was basic, (but hey it's a 2 star & â‚¬360 for 3 nights based on me & my mate sharing, worked out at â‚¬180 Euros each, which is very cheap by Amsterdam rates!) Best thing for me in our room was our shower, excellent & as hot & cold as you'd want it. Also included for our â‚¬180 was & breakfast, this consisted of scrambled eggs & bacon, with tea/coffee & toast. For a further â‚¬5 a full English is available, in my eyes though the eggs & bacon is adequate, as a couple of hot dogs, some mushrooms & a handful of beans don't justify the â‚¬5. That minor gripe apart I couldn't fault the Old Quarter at all. I must give a special mention to the staff @ reception, on the bar & also in the kitchen. I've read some negative comments on trip advisor, but we found them to be incredibly friendly & helpful. One last thing, they'd live local jazz & funk bands on all through our stay & would recommend a couple of Heineken's taking in the vibe!

Reviews.Title: “Really hard to beat this hotel in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: cabojohn
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful couple days at the Hotel Old Quarter. Reading the other reviews, I think it depends entirely on whether you get the canal view rooms or the street side rooms. We got one floor up from the canal with as good a view of the street, canal and handsome railway station, far to the left. Though we were two blocks from the busiest heart of Amsterdam, it was a very quiet, even idyllic location. Room size was good, too. We'll definitely stay there every time we can reserve one of those canal view rooms. And it's our top recommendation to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: Andrew9
Reviews.Content: If you want luxury, or even to spend a lot of time in your room(!) the Hotel Old Quarter isn't for you. But if you want an inexpensive room to sleep in in the city centre, a few minutes from the Central Station, then the Hotel Old Quarter is relatively good value for expensive Amsterdam. Last time I was in Amsterdam I paid nearly two and a half times more for a room than what I paid for a single room in the Hotel Old Quarter. The main difference between them was that my room in HOQ didn't have a bathroom. (It just had a sink). The bathroom was just outside the room and shared (I believe) with just two other rooms. My only complaints: I didn't find the floor to be very clean; and, I needed to keep the window open a lot due to poor air. (Fortunately, given that it was winter, the radiator remained hot from the time I turned it on through the duration of my half week stay). Everything else was positive: price; reliably warm room; location; breakfast - bacon and egg with either tea or coffee; quietness - though it helped that my room was not facing the street; a good bar and restaurant on the ground floor; 24 hour reception and access; and very friendly, approachable staff, all of whom speak fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “Old Quarter- Amsterdam- Great Ubication”
Reviews.Author: valensoul
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in the hotel which was very nice. The spot cannot be better if you want to be reaaaaaally near the train station (Amsterdam Centraal). Around you find coffee shops, restaurantsâ€™, stores etc. We booked through booking.nl a double room WITH toilet and shower INSIDE the room. But they gave is one without it. But the view from the room was so amazing that we almost stayed there. But we paid extra 10 Euros for that and itâ€™s always handy to have them inside your room after a long night . The receptionist took care of our demand and immediately gave is another room . Very clean. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel / Location”
Reviews.Author: Kimyvieira
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a superb area central as you can be. clean rooms cosy , shared toilet / shower always clean. Room was lovely top floor good views depending on which side you are on. The hotel Food was top quality always fresh produce hotel is well known for its famous spare-Ribs a must try . Staff always frinedly top hospitality. Nice hotel if you want a great location, clean rooms and lovely food and if you dont mind basic standards definally a hotel for couples , friends i wouldnt recommned this property to familes due to location as it apealls to a younger market. Overall really nice going back again in December 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Good place!”
Reviews.Author: travellerES
Reviews.Content: Super location (and very calm sleep at night), very nice and helpful staff, great restaurant and food. We took a long time to choose the hotel and we we rather willing to go for 3 stars as a minimum, but this one had an especially good rating and was also our preference because the price did include both the city tax and the breakfast (which is often not the case for many other similar hotels). Car parking service and especially their own restaurant where you can come down any time until 23.00 to eat was extremely convenient!! food excellent, large meals and prices really ok! we booked 2 rooms, one luxury double and the other quadruple, beds in the first room were much better. The only thing we have missed in the rooms were tea-coffee making facilities (but maybe it is normal with two stars?) and the light in the rooms could be stronger (very poor now in the evening). otherwise, shower, tv, wireless internet (in 'luxury' room) no problem. booking online with easytobook.com was very easy and convenient, and suprisingly cheaper than booking directly on the hotel's website! overall: a really very good price and quality combination.

Reviews.Title: “THE MATCHBOX”
Reviews.Author: 54321mayo
Reviews.Content: This hotel defo does not do what it says on the tin.The rooms are a joke in size.We booked a twin room that could only be compared to a glorified coffin.cheap i know but it seems to be the only lasting impression i got from it.We switched to a luxary double for the last night as a treat.luxary rooom my arse.It was double the size of the twin with a bathroom with a decent view. wow an extra 40 quid a night for a view and not to share a toilet. I struggle to find any plus bar that there was loads of coffee shops right on our doorsteps to num the pain of the place we were staying.i know people will say u get what you pay for.That is true to a certain extinct. i read all the reviews b4 i went and thought some of these people are totally overreacting.How wrong i was.I must say the free breakfast is actually alright though i am clutching straws now.the hotel also has the most stoned cat in the dam.anyways i would not recomend this hotel unless you plan on never been there.i have been to amsterdam 9 times and the nh doleen i thought was the best for value@comfort.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite place”
Reviews.Author: adampowell
Reviews.Content: We loved our room overlooking the canal. Double bed and walk in wet room ensuite. Cheap and clean. Staff were very friendly, especially the Aussie lady behind the bar. Breakfast was good and location couldn't be better. Adam and Nadine say Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, Overpriced, STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: simon99999
Reviews.Content: I made a booking at hotel on Friday night 5th Sept, and the week before I emailed the hotel the time that I would be arriving. When I arrived at the hotel at the time stated, I was told that my room had been given to someone else. I tried to explain to the woman behind the bar that I had emailed saying we would not be arriving until late on Friday night, but she was rude and not willing to listen. Eventually I was given a room which did not have a private bathroom, but was charged the same as the amount quoted for a triple room with ensuite. It does not make sense to me that a room offering less amenities should cost the same as a superior room. When I asked for a discount given that the room booked had a bathroom, I was told 'if I don't like it, leave'. This was a poor way to deal with the situation as all I was hoping for was a slight discount. On top of this the room was cramped, with poor bedding, and the pictures on the booking website are not views from the hotel, but instead from 150m down the road. I have sinced emailed the hotel manager about my experience and have not received a reply.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant value for money”
Reviews.Author: gilo617
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a weekend statying at the Hotel Old Quarter in Amsterdam. We were a bit weary bcoz we booked on a budget and not sure how a 2star would be. It was in the perfect location, our room was clean and tidy and enough space for the three of us. Will def be going back to Amsterdam and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...TINY rooms”
Reviews.Author: manzdavz
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was fantastic, although we did have a little trouble finding it...a local tramp guided us there in the end :S We were quite shocked at the size of the bedroom. We had booked a twin room, thinking we could push the beds together. But when we walked in, there were two NARROW single beds top to toe with each other against the wall, and barely enough room for my boyfriend and I to pass the beds. We ended up folding up the beds and putting the matrasses on the floor so that we could sleep together. We opted out of the ensuite option, and found the toilet and shower to be rather dirty. Breakfast was a con, and we only ate at the hotel once. Staff were ok, and we were glad to be able to leave our room keys at reception, and for a 'sort-of' 24 hour reception. After-hours it seemed to be a cleaner or someone who was handing out guests' keys.

Reviews.Title: “Beggars can't be choosers”
Reviews.Author: digbybear
Reviews.Content: We paid 82.50 Euro a day for a twin bed room with ensuite and breakfast included. The location was great, right in the Red Light district ( yes it is safe) and close to the Railway station. The room was very small but we were expecting that this is Amsterdam after all. The linen was clean, and so was the ensuite. The bathroom did have a funny odour but as we were on a canal that was to be expected too. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast included in the price was quite filling and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: sp1204
Reviews.Content: Terrible. Me and my boyfriend had booked an Ensuite Twin for â‚¬ 115 a night. While the location is excellent (easy to find, close to Central Station, bars, Red Light District,â€¦), it is easily the worst hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed at. Would never stay there again and do not recommend it. If you donâ€™t mind dirty rooms and unfriendly staff, this is the hotel for you. Note: The pictures on the hotel website are nothing like the real thing! Our room wasnâ€™t in the main house but across the road. We had to climb up a narrow and steep staircase with loose handrails to get to our room on the second floor. There was only one light in form of a plain light bulb on the first floor, so you had to be very careful at night. The room was fairly big: a double bed, a chest of drawers, a wardrobe, a sofa and a little table with a tiny TV. Again, no proper lamp, just a light bulb. The whole room had this unique prison charm (see photos). The drawers were full of dust and dirt, but the bed sheets seemed clean and the bed was comfortable. The towels were full of brown and yellow stains. Absolutely disgusting. There was constantly water dropping from the shower, and as the curtain was too short the bathroom floor was always wet. Another problem was the noise. One might think this wouldnâ€™t be an issue on the second floor, but the walls and windows were so thin that you could hear everything from the street â€“ I kept thinking that the windows were open, but they werenâ€™t. It didnâ€™t make a difference. We could have slept on the pavement and the noise level would have been the same. The free breakfast consisted of eggs with bacon, toast, butter, jam and coffee or tea. A full English breakfast with beans etc. was â‚¬ 5, and a tiny glass of orange juice was â‚¬ 3 extra. What a rip-off! The organisation was really poor, I had the impression that the waitresses didnâ€™t know what they were doing. As we are both vegetarians we ordered the egg without the bacon. There was no problem on the first day, but on the second day we had to wait a very long time. When my boyfriend politely asked a waitress she just ignored him, and when I asked her a few minutes later she replied: â€œIt takes longer without the bacon!â€� Duh. Worst excuse Iâ€™ve ever heard. After 30 minutes and a few more inquiries we finally got our toast, jam and eggs â€“ with bacon!! I had to complain again and after a total 35 minutes (my coffee was cold by then), I finally got an egg without bacon. Afterwards we complained to the hotel manager who was very friendly and apologised for the inconvenience and promised us some extras. The next day we got cheese, milk and orange juice for free. At least something. Still, I wouldnâ€™t recommend this sorry excuse of a hotel to anybody. If you do stay there, make sure you bring your own towels and enough disinfectant.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franr123
Reviews.Content: This is good budget hotel in a great location. But it is really a budget hotel. We were in room 24 which has 3 twin beds but they are narrower then regular twins. Our room had a bathroom but some rooms use the hall bathroom. Room 24 has a great view of the canal plus open windows allow a nice breeze in the room. Bedding was clean and towels were thin but worked. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. A breakfast of fried eggs, bacon, bread, and coffee or tea was included. We three ladies felt safe there. But this is truely a budget hotel so if you want the extras, don't stay here. But if you just want a clean, safe place to lay your head at night, this could work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Location spot on,”
Reviews.Author: k9ko
Reviews.Content: Location spot on for centre, we were let down by hotel only reserving 2 rooms not three, one of the rooms was a corridor with 2 camp beds end to end and a very small ensuit !!! manager John was not helpfull at all he said in a round about way like it or lump it. We ended up 2 couples sharing a shop converted into a 4 bed , well 2 bed 2 camp bed room in the sister hotel round the corner.As it was at the side of the road with a very large window the noise was very bad , so no sleep was had at all. Breakfast was nice the bread was realy fresh. I would recommend BUT check the rooms before you pay.

Reviews.Title: “2008 trip”
Reviews.Author: wood1245
Reviews.Content: 3 rooms were booked but only 2 available when checking in. attitude was not good but was offered a luxury room further down the street. 2 couples ended up sharing this larger room which was not luxury Rooms did not match the website description but were basically clean. Would advise to check rooms before paying on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “How Much Time Do You Spend There?”
Reviews.Author: slacey1070
Reviews.Content: I was slightly put off when I read some of the reviews here, however I was pleasantly surprised at what I found. Stopped here at the end of March for a stag do. Its cheap & cheerful but with a great location - for Â£30 a night you couldn't go far wrong. The shared bathroom wasn't too much of a problem, the shower clean but not very powerful & went cold if anyone in adjoining rooms turned on the hot tap. Rooms very small & in need of a coat of paint & beds small & in my case, toe to toe. Stairs were in parts very steep - not suitable for the less able. Breakfast poor - 2 eggs, 2 slices of bacon, toast & coffee, however you could upgrade for a pretty low price to a full English. Staff friendly & chatty & couldn't do enough to make us comfortable. Ideal hotel for young people looking for a cheap weekend away - however Amsterdam itself if far from cheap - beer in some places 7euros a pint - so if you are looking for somewhere cheap to drink, Amsterdam isn't the place. If I was coming as part of a couple I probably wouldn't stay here again - if I was coming for another lads weekend away, I probably would. Don't expect 5 star & think about the price - you get what you pay for - lets face it, if you come to Amsterdam you are unlikely to spend long in your room - you'll be out & about having a good time. I think maybe some expected too much judging from some of the reviews here.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped Off”
Reviews.Author: philip_doherty
Reviews.Content: I agreed a price from the internet over the phone for 75 euros and they didn't send me any confirmation of the price. When I turned up they claimed that we had agreed a price for 95!!! If I had of known I could get a room across the street for 60 euro I wouldn't have stayed. They weren't very helpful in trying to sort it out either. Tinyiest room i have stayed in, bed weren't made any of the 5 nights I was there. Shower was ok tho. I wont be back and wouldn't recommend it, there are better hotels out there folks, keep looking!!

Reviews.Title: “stand by your beds”
Reviews.Author: ceridwyn
Reviews.Content: nothing like photos on the internet. rooms small dinghy,not very clean. extremely basic. we were a party of 5 women and 1 of the group had a single roomwith 2 single beds in it and this had been classed as an upgrade as there was confusion when we arrived over the booking. room 39 3rd floor.if this was the upgrade god knows what the single room would have been like. 1 of the single beds nearest the door had been made up and the sheets were clean, however, when she pulled the bedclothes back to get into bed she was mortified to find that the mattress was sodden with pee. it seemed a coincidence but the following day in a side street 10 yards from the hotels front door was a filthy mattress on the pavement. staff were pleasent and food was ok but rooms were awful.location good wouldnt stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jonnieGloucester
Reviews.Content: Good location in the red light district, a short walk from central station. Staff were friendly. Fantastic view from hotel room of dock area and of the Damrak. Slightly dissapointed that you have to book for a minimum of 3 nights at weekends, but most hotels in Amsterdam are adopting this idea now. Would of been nice if this was explained on their website though.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, cheap and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluenosegill
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times and find this to be one of the better "cheap" places to stay. The canal view is not Venice but it is nice to see the Damrak and the many trams hurtling past. Can also see Centraal Station which is only a 5 min walk. The staff are extremely helpful and the rooms are clean, although basic (no tea/coffee facilities). The free breakfast is fantastic and sets you up nicely for those long days ahead. The hotel is also only a short walk to all the main attractions i.e. red light area, Anne Frank House, Dam Square and many museums. The clientel are not your usual hen/stag parties and tend to be couples and small groups of friends. The hotel has a great restaurant for those who like basic english meals and the bar is used by locals and tourists. All are welcome and mix well. One word of warning when travelling around the city, make sure you keep your valuables safe as you hear stories of pickpockets and thieves. Not had any issues in this hotel as they check who comes and goes at all times and you have to buzzed in everytime by a staff member, and you may have to show your room key. Makes you feel secure and may be why women stay here when travelling alone or in small groups.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eeesh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a triple room with two mates for three nights. The staff were helpful from the minute we arrived, nothing seemed too much bother for them.Room was compact but immaculately clean and the shower was out of this world. Towels were changed everyday. Only made breakfast the once but it was worth getting up for. Graet location for everything with the train station literally five minutes away. Will definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Rooms I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: DanandTan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a stag weekend in October. Location wise this place is great, 3 minutes from Centraal Station. Check in was easy and all was OK with the service. However the room was unoubtedly the smallest I have ever stayed in, its best described as a corridor. The rooms were so small that the two single beds couldn't be next to each other as the room wasn't wide enough, they had to be top to tail. If you are looking for a very central hotel an you just want a bed this is OK, although price wise it isn't super cheap.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location. Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: stevinazo
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. My major complaint is the non-en suite single room. It is CHEAP, but decent. The free breakfast is EXCELLENT. Hot eggs and ham, bread, and coffee. The not en-suite bathrooms were clean, but some had less than stelar showers. A simple walk to another floor resolved that issue. I loved the location. VERY close to Centraal station and the excellent nightlife on Warmeostraat. The stairs are crazy and steep. The staff is EXEMPLARY! Truly a gem. I hate to give off this tip but there is one room, # 7, which has the letters HO from the HOTEL sign blazing outside the front window. HIGHLY amusing!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Stay Here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gemmaj29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worst than the hostel I stayed at last year! The bedding has cigarette burns all over, the breakfast was digusting and if you wanted more than an egg and some bread its an extra 4 EUROS - complete rip off seems I paid 125 Euros a night for a so called LUXURY ROOM!!
