My recommendaion would be to stay at the Hotel Luxer if you want a nice hotel (opposite the Old Quarter) or for something a little cheaper stay at the Winston Hostel (top end of the same street). I also had my lovely white bath sheet STOLEN from the room, when I asked for it to be returned they sad yes, but I still ended up leaving without it! The only good thing about this hotel was the lovely view of the canel and the location. The staff were initially friendly until I complained (politely) and they completely dismissed my issues without even an applogie! This hotel gets my award of "THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN"

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but Basic”
Reviews.Author: NicholaSwallow
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Old Quarter. The hotel is only a 3 minute walk away from Central Station and is in the very lively Red-Light district. We had a triple room with en-suite shower facilities, which was basic and in need of some modernisation but overall we had a comfortable stay. The street outside the hotel can get very noisey and there is no air-con so we found the room was a little stuffy at times, but in general we had a problem free stay. As In all old buildings in Amsterdam, the stairs are very narrow and steep so this hotel is probably not ideal for elderly travellers. At the same time, the hotel is in the middle of the Red-Light district and is surrounded by sex shops and hash selling coffee shops so this probably isnt suitable for children. Overall we found this hotel to be cheap and cheerful and ideal for young travellers looking for a good time on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Top once again”
Reviews.Author: DuffymoonWarrington
Reviews.Content: Ian and Jacki form Warrington England Just returned from our third trip to amsterdam,stayed eveytime at the old quarter.Staff super friendly,excellent breakfast (FREE WITH ROOM) .Stayed in luxury room with canal view (Simple but clean).Right at the start of the redlight district with plenty of coffee shops and restaurants on your doorstep,can't wait to go again would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jobbie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the old quarter for 3 nights and found it to be perfect. Great location for a hotel, right on the warmoestraat which is full of pubs, eateries etc. Stayed in a twin room which was a bit small but done the trick if you are just looking for somewhere to get your head down. Who the hell wants to stay in a hotel room all day when you are in amsterdam? Decent breakfast in the morning which is included in the price and the bar is ok for a drink also. Gonna go back to amsterdam for the new year and maybe consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glasgowtravel
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel,with this being my first time to Amsterdam, very friendly staff,lovely rooms, beds are very comfy. The food is variable & enjoyable. The location of this hotel is great as its right in the heart of Amsterdam. Prices for this hotel are very reasonable I will definately be back & staying in the Old Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Poor excuse for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: view2
Reviews.Content: These guys don't have pictures of their rooms on the website. If they did they would probably have trouble filling them. Yes, the room was so small we could not open a suitcase inside. Quite shabby really, worn, musty carperts. Thin wooden doors, hear everyone noise from the corridors. Luckily we got one of the rooms not facing the street, which is very busy especially at night. It reminded me of time spent in the military, thin, worn beds which could have been army issue - in Vietnam. The even smaller bathroom only had room for one person at the time. I could sit on the toilet while showering, if you find this practical. Staff are indifferent at best, only time they really paid attention was upon arrival when the wanted payment upfront. I suppose this could work out for stag trips and people just coming over to party all day and night. For me this was horrid. The funny thing is the next time we went to Amsterdam, we got the Marriott on Priceline for the same price (100 euros) A world of difference.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not luxury (no where near)”
Reviews.Author: JoJoDenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend, just a quick, cheap get away and if thats all your looking for then it should be ok. It was situated right in town close to everything and that was a real bonus and meant we could come and go as we pleased. The room was very small but had two beds and a small toilet - again we only wanted to sleep here so for us it was fine but if you want to spend any time in the room it wasn't ideal. The breakfast was ok - basic but tasted ok and you could get toast as well if you asked. The only real downside was that the room wasn't cleaned before we arrived in fact it still had broken bits of a plastic glass on the floor and it looked like the bedding hadn't been changed! For this reason I probably wouldn't stay here again but for the money 200euros for 2nights it wasn't too bad and if you want cheap and cheerful then maybe it's for you.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but no more”
Reviews.Author: Bob's yer Uncle
Reviews.Content: We booked a 'luxury double room with canal view' for 100 euros a night. Having been to Amsterdam previously I took the word luxury with a pinch of salt and wasn't disappointed. It was an average to mediocre room, but it was a double with a canal view. I'd certainly not want to be at the front of this hotel with the noise of the street, so that made the extra cost worth the price. The windows hardly opened though, they just tilted inwards slightly and in hot, stuffy conditions we were sweating buckets constantly. I'd not go to Amsterdam in the summer again, unless it was to a genuine quality hotel with a/c (we did not have this despite the claim of a 'luxury' room). The bathroom was also average, the shower and toilet were combined instead of it being a separate cubicle so the shower water just went down through a hole in the floor. If it wasn't so hot the bathroom floor would have been constantly wet from the previous day's shower I suspect, especially in winter. Breakfast was 'included' but only if you wanted the 'bacon and eggs' (I don't touch eggs), which turned out to be an omelette. The 'full English' was 4.50 euros and orange juice another 2.25. Payment was expected immediately prior to leaving the table too, (as was the cost of the room immediately upon arrival at the hotel). Service was perfunctory, you do not feel like valued guests and I can't imagine they'd go out of their way to help if you had a problem. Pluses - the hotel does have a lift, which is unusual for these prices in Amsterdam, and that does make life much easier. And the room was clean. And it is in the heart of the RLD action and in walking distance to CS. Overall, in other cities you'd be disappointed with the standard for this price of room , but in Amsterdam it was adequate - just forget any notion of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “friendly excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Old Quarter is excellent value for money, the staff are friendly and will give any information on the local area that you may require. It is situated within a five minute walk of central station. I have stayed here a few times and it is ideal if a party of people are travelling. The rooms are comfortable and I personally have had no problems staying here. I frequently visit Amsterdam and when staying overnight I always try to stay at the Old Quarter as it has everything that you need, the breakfast is just what you need to start the day and if you have an evening meal the choice is good and very hearty.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Cheerful, Central”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Teee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 4 lady friends for my hen trip in April 2004. I think when people book accomodation in Amsterdam they need to bear in mind several things: ~ This city is always full, therefore certain standards are not as rigorously kept to as in other European countries. ~ Buildings are tall and narrow so there are lots of steep, narrow and scary staircases with not many lifts. If you know this before you go then it should make your trip more pleasant. I say all that above because Old Quarter is basic, a little run down and full of scary staircases. However the rooms are cheap (even for AMS), the pub is good fun and you are on Warmoestraat which will please any porn or weed fan :-) Stay here for a short break if you are a student (or have student standards) or literally just want a bed and a shower in between 'coffees'. A great location, a lovely view of the canal or super busy street, friendly staff and pub downstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 weeks in Amsterdam in Oct 2005 at the Old Quarter Hotel. It had been recommended by a friend, but I warn you I do not recommend it. My deluxe room was not deluxe and the food offered in the restaurant was deplorable. They offered a free breakfast with the room, which I refused to eat. My room was not serviced for the entire 2 weeks I was there. There are many other wonderful options in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy”
Reviews.Author: Dingin
Reviews.Content: This place is ideal if you just want somewhere SIMPLE to stay for a few days! Its great value for money. Its in an ideal location just off Damrak square, close to the train station, loads of shops and of course coffee shops! And for the boys...the redlight district is very close! The rooms are clean and the restaurant downstairs serves lovely food! The staff are very friendly and very helpful! I would recommend this hotel to students, groups and couples. I know other people that have stayed in this hotel and they have decribed it as a cosy little gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: eilisnimhidhe
Reviews.Content: A group of us travelled to Amsterdam for a weekend at the end of March 2006. The "hotel" is attached to a pub (nice pub with nice food)and the location is very central. However we booked 3 double rooms months in advance and when we were directed to our rooms we were all on seperate floors with my partner and I in the basement - please see the photo, i could have cried it was so hideous - I have plenty of experience travelling and backpacking and have never (with one exception) stayed in such a bad place. The room was in the basement down these narrow steep stairs and the only other room down there was the bars store room where you were constantly subjected to the entire staff thumping down the stairs and banging aroung in the store room at all hours of the morning and night. The room was damp and have an awful stench. The canal came right up to our window cill. See second photo. When we complained we were told that they have no other room available and that the room is lovely and we had no reason to complain - what was our problem. I would not recommend staying here under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the coffee shops!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfreind and I stayed here with 2 other couples in March 2006. The hotel itself is quite basic, but rooms were adequate for a place to put your head down and were clean with very comfortable beds. The hotel is located close to Centraal station (about 5 mins walk) and the street that it's on is lined with coffee shops and head shops! A 5 minute walk will bring you to Dam Square with an array of shops (yes, there are shops which don't sell mind bending goods!), banks and restaurants. This hotel offers great valus for money in a very central location. The Hotel has a lively restaurant and Bar and I found the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a ball!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a hen weekend, Amsterdam is amazing! The people are lovely, really friendly and the hotel "Old Quarter" was brilliant, somewhere to eat and sleep and located near everything.. cafes, bars, red light district, shops.. what more could you ask for! A brilliant experience, will defo be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: umbrellahead
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 25-27Nov, booked luxury double room with canal view. I wouldn't say it was luxury, but it was clean, big enough double bed, and with a great view of canal. There was a bit of a smell in the bar/restaurant area- just as you walk in,but as you walked through to the hotel the only smell was of weed. Great location- 2 mins walk to Red light district, and a short stroll to Dam square. Would definitely stay there again. The walls are pretty thin in the rooms, So keep your voice down if you don't want people hearing you!! Other than that Its a grand place.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal cheap accommodation in the heart of tourist Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Thackeray
Reviews.Content: Ideal cheap accommodation if you want a hotel rather than hostel for one or two nights in the heart of tourist Amsterdam. Staff v. friendly. Excellent bar. Reasonable breakfast. Avoid room overlooking noisey street unless you are into people watching. Good luggage storage facility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a couple times (Nov. 2003 and June 2004) and was not disappointed. After reading other reviews on this website, it strikes me that a few other travellers expected a bit more than what was offered at this budget hotel. The location is great and very close to the red light district (but not so close it's dodgy) and it's well within the tourist hub of the city while close to the shopping and more upscale neighborhoods. Both times I stayed at this hotel I requested a canal view over the Damrak and was quite pleased with it (both times). The only downside is the price - the place feels like a hostel with a REALLY good view but is priced more like a hotel. Still, get an open window view over the canal and Damrak and you will never complain.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in the Old Quarter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Make sure that you are away from the front of the building, the noise from the bar and the street is horrendous if you like to sleep. Bring wax ear-plugs.The rooms are tiny and spartan. The middle aged blond woman running the place could take your head off, though the rest of the staff seem fine. But it is clean and safe, and probabaly worth what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly functional - perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent stayer at the old quarter, most recently November 2004. This hotel is perfect at providing the facilities i need for a cheap weekend break in the 'dam. Location is excellent, resturant is fine, bar is open late. If you're visiting one of the finest European capitals for the culture and finesse, the Hotel Old Quarter would be the wrong choice. It does however excel at providing inexpensive, functional and secure digs in a fine central location.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: gavin117
Reviews.Content: the room were of a v poor standard. small and v noisey. they looked nothing like the picture on website. my advice would be NOT to book here! i also suffered backache from the low quality prison-cell like mattress

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Old Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: Warmoestraat 22, Amsterdam 1012 JD, The Netherlands
